mods.abstract: The scene presents a view of a park similar to Jackson Square in New Orleans. The satire is of a sad nature. The viewer is drawn into the scene by the pleasant activities of the children and the projection of warm environment. It is only after thus acquainted that the viewer takes note of the pregnant girl on the bench. The children in the background don't face the problems that the older ones do.
mods.note: This lithograph was printed in 1945 by the artist at LSU in Baton Rouge, LA. The drawing , done on stone, was made by using a lithographic pencil with no scraping employed. The lithograph is printed on a quality rag paper.

name.namePart: Louisiana State University (Baton Rouge, La.). Museum of Art
